ftbquests.chapter.advance.quest463809102: The advanced chapter is prepared for players unfamiliar with certain mods, guiding their general progression.
Because they involve hostile mobs or have &6very convoluted&r progression, these mods are somewhat difficult. Skillful use of mods from the basic chapter can reduce the frustration.
If you find these chapters difficult to complete, try:
1. Eat more varieties of food to increase max health.
2. Collect more Artifacts to boost special attributes.
3. Try using Create machinery to skip progression.
4. Let Touhou maids help you fight mobs.
5. First complete the &aRusty Spell Mage&r chapter.
ftbquests.chapter.advance.title: &aAdvanced Chapter Overview
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest18384791: Put bread dough into the oven, set the right temperature, wait a while, and you'll get delicious bread.

Bread tooltips show the minimum baking temperature required; each bread also has its own &6perfect temperature&r. Bread baked at perfect temperature grants extra effects and can be eaten regardless of hunger.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest23068826: Hold a bread knife in off-hand, right-click with an egg to get raw egg; right-click with raw egg to separate yolk and white.
Whip them together in a mixer, then combine to make cake batter.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest42016012: To make bread, you first need yeast. Place three portions of &3whole wheat flour&r and a bottle of water into a fermenting jar. After some time it becomes yeast, which can be collected with a glass bottle.
You can also obtain yeast by trading with a baker.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest46032152: To become a pastry chef, a mixer is essential.
&bMost ingredients from this mod have been replaced; you can obtain them through other mods' methods.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest54888307: Put milk and salt into a fermenting jar; after some time it becomes cheese, right-click to collect.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest61256169: Pour cake batter into a mold, bake at 170°C in the oven, then place the mold on a table and right-click to unmold.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest69608441: As a pastry chef, how could you not have your own bread knife?
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest71376672: Add yeast, flour, and other ingredients into the mixer. After mixing and fermenting, you'll get dough.
Different breads require different dough recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest72092963: Cake base can already be eaten, but to make a cake it needs further processing.
Slice the cake base with a bread knife, place on a table, then layer in order: cake slice – cream – cake slice – cream – sweet berries, to make a cream cake.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest74989289: You can also make a cake roll. First slice the cake base in half with a bread knife, place parchment paper on the table, then put cake slices on it. Right-click with ingredients, then right-click empty-handed to finish the roll.

Cake rolls can be eaten regardless of hunger. Each roll can hold up to four ingredients, inheriting all their effects (plus the roll's softness). Duplicate effects don't stack. Ingredient rules: 1. No block form, 2. No container, 3. No forced tags, 4. Not another cake roll.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.quest81499566: Place dough on the dough shaping table to roll it into different bread bases. Some bases can be filled to become other types.
ftbquests.chapter.bakeries.title: &eTown Pastry Chef
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest11256952533: &bThis chapter is the starting guide. If you don't know where to begin, read this.
Wood is the beginning of everything.
&6A journey of a hundred miles begins with punching trees
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest17908719313: Put raw iron into a blast furnace, you get your first iron ingot.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest22218928378: Smelt the raw copper you mined in a furnace to get copper ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest33364673290: Then mine more raw copper, smelt more ingots, and craft copper blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest37366247036: Wood alone isn't enough — you also need cobblestone.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest41113090743: Put cobblestone into a furnace to smelt it into stone.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest41984786056: But you're not satisfied. Making a blast furnace is too complicated, not suitable for mass iron production.
In ruins and villages, you find some mysterious machines.
You dismantle them, trying to recover iron ingots; touching these machines suddenly fills your mind with knowledge.
It seems to be an ancient and powerful technology. You press &a[W]&r, begin to ponder, and try to digest this knowledge…
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest44361624256: Finally, with all materials gathered, you craft a blast furnace.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest53609870200: With cobblestone, you can make a furnace. You try smelting iron, but it doesn't work.
You press &a[U]&r on raw iron to check how to smelt it, and discover it requires a blast furnace; then you press &a[R]&r on the blast furnace to see how to craft it.
It looks complicated, but still within your ability.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest71428381611: Holding deepslate cobblestone, you right-click a grindstone. It turns into polished deepslate — exactly what you need.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest82292255936: Then you craft stone slabs, combine with wood to make a grindstone.
Right-clicking the grindstone with items lets you grind them. Deepslate cobblestone happens to be grindable.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quest84315238655: You venture deep underground and mine some deepslate cobblestone.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.title: &eJourney Begins
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest160063075: Start with a Artisan's Workstation, furniture all hand-made!

Similar to Axiom, Immersive Furniture lets you DIY beautiful furniture, decorations, and objects in-game, or choose from a huge online market. Supports particle effects, sounds, sitting and lying functions.
For example, here's a Power. Hey Vergil your portal opening days are over, give me the Yamato.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest179638917: Actually no candles… but provides furniture suitable for modern cafeterias, including long tables.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest190197094: Provides TVs — you can use them to show pictures or Youtube videos.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest225494391: Biome mod, adds extra wood, stone, and important flowers!
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest240345176: Biome mod, adds extra wood and stone.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest240815918: Adds a series of beach-themed decorations and foods.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest313256266: Create itself already adds many stone types; Create Deco expands the style to more blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest424101718: Ultramarine provides many interior and exterior blocks for Chinese-style architecture.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest486152860: This chapter is for builders, briefly introducing the architectural styles of different mods.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest523931529: Adds Japanese-style building blocks and furniture.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest536891385: Adds tall doors and short doors. Create-style doors are included too.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest597244211: Adds railway components, various tracks, and train exteriors.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest789504958: Adds train glass and premium seating.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest851597894: Adds… figurines and statues. See the relevant chapter for how to craft figurines.
Interior: Touhou Little Maid Figurines \& Statues
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest867688644: A town-themed mod, adds many plant-related decorations.
ftbquests.chapter.builder.quest882776136: Another Furniture adds vanilla-styled wooden furniture.
Includes cabinet doors, cupboards, shelves, chairs, tables, shutters, flower boxes, benches, lamps, stools, sofas, bar stools, curtains, and service bells.
Use a hammer to right-click and adjust cabinet doors (style) and benches (with or without backrest).
ftbquests.chapter.builder.title: &bArchitect's Design Book
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest2787778106: &bCrystalline Flower&r can only be planted on Glistering Honey Crystal or Amethyst blocks. Feed it items (usually flowers) or experience, or throw items to generate XP orbs, to make it grow and level up (leave enough space).
Insert a book and spend sufficient levels, and the &bCrystalline Flower&r can roll any enchant obtainable from the enchanting table, including treasure enchants. Use this to obtain Printer templates.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest3004535039: &6The Bumblezone&r is one of the pack's few 'adventure' mods, providing abundant honey resources and solid endgame gear.
Like Twilight Forest, Bumblezone progression relies heavily on advancements, so it's recommended to follow them in order.
Throw an Ender Pearl into a beehive, or push yourself into one with a piston, to enter the Bumblezone.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest3586416816: &bPotion Candles&r, when lit, grant effects to nearby entities. Effects are determined by up to five potions inserted during crafting. Multi-effect setups can be refreshed by removing and reinserting potions.
More bottles of the same potion extend duration; splash potions add +2 range; lingering potions double effect duration on entities.
&bPotion Candles&r can provide a stable Resistance IV source, making &bResonant Feather&r acquisition easy.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest5906441837: After consuming &bEssence of the Bees&r, use a Structure Compass to locate the &6Sempiternal Sanctums&r.
The &6Sempiternal Sanctums&r has six colors, each with distinct challenges and rewards. Challenge timers run at one-third real time.
&4Red&r: 400s to defeat 100 mobs. Recommendation: Iron's Spellbook.
&eYellow&r: Fly through 100 black rings within 270s. Recommendation: attempt after obtaining flight.
&bBlue&r: Defeat 50 mobs underwater within 500s. Recommendation: Water Breathing potion or helmet, Boiled Pickerelweed, and diving goggles.

&aGreen&r: Bat mudballs back 30 times within 300s; throwing your own is allowed. You can only hit while standing on the platform, and mudballs will knock off equipment. Bring plenty to deal damage. Green essence helps cultivate rare crops.
&5Purple&r: Dodge spikes for 270s; flight is forbidden. Recommendation: use F5 (Kenadian: I used F5), bring enough food and digestion aids for fast healing.
White: Kill 6 Cosmic Crystals within 500s with damage limits. Recommendation: Iron's Spell Chain Lightning.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest7241528357: &6Cell Maze&r isn't required for progression, but contains many items you'll need later.
Use a Structure Compass to find the &6Cell Maze&r. Before entering, craft a &bFlower Headwear&r to resist Bee Aggression.

Loot containers in the &6Cell Maze&r are &bHoney Cocoon&r. Silk Touch preserves contents; but &aif a honey cocoon is a loot chest&r, breaking it &aimmediately loses&r its items. Don't use honey cocoom as storage.
Prioritize collecting &bStinger Spears&r, &bHoney Crystal Shards&r, and &bBumble Bee Armor&r from armor stands.
&6Cell Maze&r is also a great source of flowers, especially rare ones with unknown biomes.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.quest7670110343: In the &6Cell Maze&r, find a compass pointing to the &6Throne Pillar&r. The &cBee Queen&r resides there — save the coordinates.
Right-click the &cBee Queen&r with certain items to trade for various unique goods.
Trading once unlocks the &cBee Queen&r questline; see Bumblezone advancements for tasks. Rewards include &bRoyal Jelly&r, and upon full completion, &bEssence of the Bees&r.
&bRoyal Jelly&r is essential for Potion Candles, and &bEssence of the Bees&r is required for later steps. Only after consuming it can you find the compass to the &6Sempiternal Sanctums&r and enter.
ftbquests.chapter.bumble.title: &aQueen of Bumblezone
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest248101963822: To achieve greater speed, you need to master the power of the Sculk…
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest311169466271: &o&5Ordinary knowledge no longer satisfies you. You begin to seek forbidden knowledge…&r
Set up the right environment inside a Mob Cage, insert DNA, and the cage will automatically produce creatures. When they mature, right-click with a sword to obtain their drops.
Normal Mob Cages are mainly used as DNA transfer stations to get spawn eggs, and then use natural spawners to produce entities.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest329936840138: &bHopping Mob Cage&r automatically collects and outputs products into the container below, no manual collection needed.
&bHopping Mob Cage&r can easily be embedded into Create production lines, serving as a stable source of certain mob resources.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest348290627261: To obtain DNA, you need a DNA Sampler. Different materials allow extraction from different creatures.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest476413656250: Basic acceleration chip, materials are easy to obtain.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest551049512433: Simulated arrows, only used to produce music discs.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest551994377496: Overall, Poseidon blocks are time-consuming. It's recommended to build multiple cages and add upgrades.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest631794445825: Increases rare drop quantity, though usually less effective than efficiency upgrades II.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest660666165964: Can produce XP particles, but requires further processing to convert into liquid XP.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.quest858964047867: The first 18 Shulker Shells and 9 Phantom Membranes must be obtained manually; afterwards DNA Sampler allows automatic production.
ftbquests.chapter.cage.title: &5Forbidden Knowledge Seeker
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1016846005: Inventory Access Port can intelligently change the connection direction between storage and hoppers.
Inventory Bridge lets hoppers and other components access two storages at once.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1062025444: Right-click a Blaze or Blaze spawner with an empty Blaze Burner to obtain it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1087994239: Flight Ring allows players to enable creative flight.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1222139869: Why does this require so much iron.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1224969253: Create: Connected not only adds more transmission methods, but also more ways to control stress networks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1424952179: Create: Connected adds more transmission components to Create, making wiring less of a headache (perhaps).
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1442894209: Honestly, you should try it — it's really useful.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1532099902: You can place up to 8 toolboxes on the ground. If you can't access them, remember to change keybinds.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1813481287: Rotation Speed Controller can only transmit stress via large gears. Right-click to adjust output speed.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest1926027466: Throw wheat into the top of a Millstone, wait for grinding, then right-click empty-handed to collect.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2130891804: Acts like a Shaft. With goggles equipped, you can see its RPM on the Speedometer and stress usage on the Stressometer.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2189913235: Before you craft a  Mechanical Press, this is the only working component available.
It can increase dye yields and, most importantly, grind wheat into flour.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2252168583: Factory instruments must be bound to a linker with right‑click before use. They have two modes: Restock and Recipe.

When attached to a packager, they run in Restock mode. Right‑click to set a quantity. The instrument repeatedly signals the linker so packagers in the network output packages containing the required items until the set amount is reached.

When attached to other blocks, they run in Recipe mode. They define the production chain, deciding what inputs are used and where they are processed. You can use them to create a full pipeline. Right‑click the instrument to set a target quantity; while the network has less than that, it will repeatedly dispatch according to the rules.

In Recipe mode, the instrument sends a signal every 20 ticks by default (configurable) and won't send another package until products from the previous package return to the network. For continuous dispatch or probabilistic outputs, adjust the expiry time below. If the timeout passes without obtaining the item, it will send again—this can cause over‑dispatch and waste.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2533771294: You can also put items like iron ingots on belts and press them with the Mechanical Press.
Depots and belts are effectively containers—items placed on them won't disappear naturally.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest2936587044: Belts are the only power‑transmission component that also moves items and entities.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3367464725: The Reactor Controller's ponder explains setup very clearly—just build it accordingly.
Max temperature 1000; overheating explodes within a few minutes.
You can reference the control blueprint given as the quest reward for placement.
&e[WARN]&aLack of fuel will only shut down the nuclear; overheating will explode. Build it far away and use void chests/motors for input and output.&r
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3381149956: The powered rolling machine can compress certain items in a basin into blocks, or process some fluid recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3444346709: These components let you transmit stress, fluids, items, and energy over long distances.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3472263415: Try building an automated Netherite Scrap line?
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3517139181: One of Create's least‑used components—on redstone signal, it toggles adhesion.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest3707153826: Place water/wet blocks before an Encased Fan to wash items in bulk; place lava to smelt in bulk; place a campfire/Blaze Burner/lit empty Blaze Burner or lit fire to smoke in bulk; place a soul campfire/Blaze Burner lit with soul soil/soul sand or lit soul fire to haunt items in bulk.
An Encased Fan processes all drops in its wind path and items on depots, so it can handle large batches at once.
Don't forget to try this catalyst.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4088471462: Train Schedules direct Train Conductors. Hand a configured schedule to a conductor, and the train will run autonomously under their control. Any mob or Blaze Burner can serve as a conductor.
Holding a Train Signal shows the divided sections—connected track segments of the same color form one section.
Signals ensure only one train occupies a section at a time to prevent collisions. If a section is occupied, signals block trains from entering from the rear.
Indicator lights on the signal's side show state; placing Glow Tubes there makes signals more visible.
Signal states control train behavior:
Solid / Glow Tube red solid: a train is in the next section and blocks entry. No passage.
Solid / Glow Tube red solid: locked by redstone signal. No passage.
Flashing / Glow Tube red flashing: section invalid because the track forms a loop. Passage allowed.
Off / Glow Tube white solid: no train in the next section. Passage allowed.
Right‑click with a wrench to set a signal to “brass” mode—then it considers the next two sections ahead.
This allows trains to pass immediately when the next section can be cleared, helping prevent gridlock at crossroads.
Right‑click to open the GUI and create a schedule. Set the route at the top. The three buttons below are: loop yes/no, reset progress, skip current step. The last two work only after departure.
In “brass” mode a solid yellow light may appear: among the first section's branches, one or more show solid red—but not all.
If all branch paths show solid red, the signal will also show solid red.
A Train Signal in red state can output a redstone signal via a comparator.
Before placing a Train Observer, right-click a Train Track to set its target track.
When a train passes over the target track of the Train Observer, it will emit a redstone signal until the train leaves.
Its side indicator light turns on while emitting a signal.
Right-click it with an item/filter to set cargo filtering; it only emits a redstone signal when a train carrying the target cargo passes over the observer's track.
Click the plus to add a stop or action. Modes: Go to Station, Update Title, Limit Max Speed, Emit Redstone, Waypoint via Station.
For “Go to Station,” you can set conditions to be met on arrival before proceeding.
Departure requires all conditions in any one column, not the same row.
When stations share names, trains choose the nearest unoccupied platform.
Before placing a Train Signal, right‑click a Train Track to set the target; then place the signal anywhere near that track.
Train Signals can restrict direction of travel in a block section; players can't schedule trains against the set direction. Two opposing signals on the same track allow bidirectional travel.
Signals divide tracks before and after them into distinct “sections.”
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4118590896: Super Glue sticks blocks together — very useful for windmills or multi-block minecarts.
Right-click a block to set the first coordinate, then right-click a second block; all blocks in the rectangular prism between these two points will be glued.
When Super Glue is in the off-hand, blocks you place with the main hand will automatically glue to the clicked block.
When a structure becomes dynamic, it drives all glued blocks together.
Left-click anywhere inside the glued prism to remove all glue within that prism.
Gluing on the axial face of Linear Chassis and the lateral face of Radial Chassis works like Slime Balls and doesn't consume durability.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4355037646: A mineral with a very awkward status.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4393962753: In Create you don't need to produce tons of slime balls like vanilla — a stack may be enough.

Right-click with a slime ball to glue the axial face of Linear Chassis and the lateral face of Radial Chassis. This doesn't consume the slime ball. Glued faces stick to adjacent blocks of the same type; adjust the number of glued blocks with a wrench on the non-glued face.
Right-click twice with a slime ball to also glue the back face.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4557091961: Smelt copper and zinc together in a heated basin to obtain brass ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4630240349: Before you build a Steam Boiler or Crank Engine (what's that?), windmills are your highest-stress power source. Try powering all your machines with a max-speed windmill — just don't overload it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4764409341: Silk Touch Amethyst Clusters and crush them with Crushing Wheels to increase Amethyst Shard yield; process Amethyst Blocks with a pickaxe on a Cutting Board to get 4 shards.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4854968314: Smelt your kelp in a smoker — and don't eat it all.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4888845444: You're one step away from Mechanical Arms.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4902312551: Tip: When items are on the ground, they can be processed simultaneously by fans above and below. Also, when an unlit Blaze Burner is in front of a fan, wind passes through without changing the processing type.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4906207437: You can now build all kinds of Create machines. From here, quest rewards won't walk you through crafting each component; they'll introduce functions instead.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest4987355544: A bit pricey, but worth it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5064099602: After selecting a fling destination, first check whether the flung items will be blocked by any blocks along the path.
Man, hope it doesn't jam your line.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5108390620: In Create, andesite leaps from “waste stone” to foundational resource.
Don't worry — you have many ways to automate andesite.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5179148864: Shafts are the cheapest way to transmit power.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5320111923: Crane multiblock moves along the crane arm's axis and stops when encountering blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5366835295: A more advanced Rail Schedule that displays routes and more train info.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5458596234: Some resources must be gathered in the Nether — mine plenty.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5469484464: It's one size larger than a Water Wheel and spins at half the RPM, but produces twice the stress.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5551272236: From now on, try building a full automation line yourself.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5746770931: These two tanks can finally be rotated.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest5759910421: Starting quest is in the top-left
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6010214954: Rope Pulley multiblock moves along the Y-axis and stops when encountering blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6037634415: Each piece of sandpaper has only 8 durability — prepare crafting blueprints.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6564895868: &cCard Reader&r identifies magnetic card authenticity. First use requires binding by right-click with a card. On correct card, outputs redstone signal strength 15 for 3s. Right-click with Brass Sheets to hide blocks behind it, useful for hiding redstone lines.
&cCard Inscriber&r works with &cEmpty Card&r. Insert an Empty Card, Ink Sac, and Name Tag to write a magnetic card.
&cSprinkler&r accelerates crop growth in a 5×5 area. Mix Bone Meal and water in a basin, pump into the Sprinkler, and it starts automatically when filled with 1000 mB of &cBonemeal&r.

&cBrass Speaker&r plays audio to players in range when receiving redstone and sends a message "[speaker]" + "custom text". Range is a sphere of radius 10 centered on itself. Add custom text via a renamed Name Tag.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6630804248: To get rich, punch trees first
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6641722322: With a Tablecloth in hand, right-click a Manager Transmitter to set traded items, quantities, and package name (be sure to set it!).
After placing the tablecloth, you can set price and quantity on the front side.

Right-click the tablecloth empty-handed to get a shopping list; right-click with the list to buy more items. Give the list to the manager to check out, and the transmitter will request packages containing the required items.
Trade outputs are stored in the transmitter used for checkout; right-click to retrieve, or output directly via hopper/chute.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6679032175: Uranium can be found underground; it's the core of nuclear power.
Of course, you'll need lead for radiation protection.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6794524520: This isn't a brass pickaxe… wait, who are you?
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest6824017180: Getting lime dye or green dye will no longer be a problem.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7154237404: You can now transmit power horizontally, but you'll have better options.
Tip: Large gears can change the direction of power, great when you want to save casings.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7233655342: Packagers tightly wrap items from adjacent inventories into packages for transport, improving throughput; placing a placard on a packager names the packages so they can be routed to specific destinations.
Place a Storage Linker on a packager to form a storage network. Right‑click the linker with another linker already in the network, then attach to another packager to join the network.

Right‑click a linker with a Transmitter to join the network. The transmitter needs a manager nearby to work. A manager can be a Blaze Burner or creatures on cushions such as parrots, frogs, pigs, Wifefox, Baka Cirno… etc. (but not villagers).

Right‑click the manager to administer the network. The center shows items in the network (counts may be inaccurate). At the bottom, enter a package name to dispatch — it will request required items from packagers in the network and output them as a package to the specified destination.
You can also input JEI recipes; in that case, it outputs recipe‑tagged packages for crafting.
Item Safes or Drawers are typically used as suitable storage network containers.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7239446609: Bearing multiblock performs circular motion; during motion the multiblock structure can pass through blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7491398192: Minecart multiblock moves along rails; during motion the multiblock structure can pass through blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7516634458: Besides vanilla iron farms, you also have other ways to automate iron.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest7942786962: Named packages need a destination and an accepting device.
Package Frogport can hang packages from the packager below it onto chains and accept packages with the same name. Powering the packager can prevent it from receiving.
You can also use a Package Filter to filter packages on containers/conveyors.
Void Chest + Package Filter = Package Frogport
Mailboxes bind to train stations and can transport packages across areas via trains.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8127575592: You've basically learned how to craft Create's basic components; now it's time to use them to generate power.
Even with multiple choices, players generally recommend windmills as an early power source.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8318518045: Combine wheat flour with a water bucket to get dough; the recipe returns the empty bucket.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8320472698: You might need a Nature's Compass, but it isn't easy to make.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8355240922: The Disenchanter removes non‑curse enchantments and obtains Liquid XP from various sources.
Pump Liquid XP into the Printer with Create fluid components, then right‑click with an Enchanted Book to copy the mother book's enchantments onto the book below.
Note: If any enchantment level on the mother book exceeds its normal maximum level, you must pump Liquid Overexperience into the Printer to complete copying.
Pump ink into the Printer, then right‑click with a Train Schedule book to clone it onto the schedule below.
Pump Liquid XP into the Printer, then right‑click with a Name Tag to copy the same name onto the Name Tag below.
Pump Liquid XP into the Printer, then right‑click with a Name Tag to name the item below to the Name Tag's name.
Pump Liquid Overexperience into the Printer, then right‑click with an Ancient Tome to upgrade any Enchanted Book below into the same Ancient Tome.
The Disenchanter can accept items from the side via conveyor belts, hoppers, or basins. You can also right‑click while holding an item to place it directly onto the Disenchanter.
The Disenchanter has two modes: Conversion and Absorption.

Conversion: Always takes 10 ticks to process 1 item, producing an output. Items spin above the Disenchanter during processing, and a grinding sound plays when complete. If the Disenchanter lacks enough capacity for the resulting liquid XP, the item will wait above it.
Absorption: Instantly consumes a full stack without producing any output. Items vanish as soon as they enter the Disenchanter. If it cannot store the liquid XP, the item will tumble and pass through.
Every 10 ticks, the Disenchanter attempts to draw XP from nearby players or orbs, storing it internally as fluid.
Each attempt can drain up to 100 XP points from a player.
The Printer is used to duplicate written books or enchanted books.
Pump ink into the Printer using fluid components like a mechanical pump. Then right‑click with a book to provide the master copy. The Printer will duplicate books placed beneath it.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quest8377065966: &6Place Train Station and Bogies
You can install two train cabs on one train structure to allow bidirectional driving.
&6Train Arrival
When driving a train, if a station is ahead, hold Space to enter. You can also use a timetable, but the train's direction must match the station.
Stations with the same name are treated as platforms of the same station. Trains will choose an empty platform to stop at.
In the station GUI, you can set which side doors open when a train arrives.
When a train enters a station, a red flag rises.
After arrival, you can click “Dismantle Train” in the GUI to revert the train into blocks.
&6Train Control
Once assembled, the train cab shows two levers. Right‑click the cab to enter control mode.
In control mode, your XP bar is replaced with a speed bar.
Before placing a station, right‑click a track to set it as the target. Then place the station near that track.
Use WASD to drive. The speed bar shows current speed, divided into 18 segments across five stages.
Speed decreases when turning.
Scroll the mouse wheel to adjust the speed cap, shown by a brass slider.
The arrow above the speed bar shows the train's forward direction relative to your view.
If the train has a whistle, press Ctrl to blow it.
&6Train Coupling
Right‑click a track, then place a coupler nearby. If the track length fits, two hook points appear: one on the chosen track, the other in the facing direction.
Hooks come in pairs: green markers face inward, red outward. Hooks can coexist with other train parts, shifting icons to the sides.
With a wrench, configure hook spacing on top of the coupler. Default is 5m, minimum 3m, maximum 15m.

Right‑click the coupler with a wrench to change its mode. Check textures or wear &eEngineer Goggles&r to identify. When aiming at a coupler or hook with a wrench, both highlight along with their link.
Right‑click a station to open its GUI, then click “Create New Train.” A blue flag rises.
&6Train Coupling II
Before coupling, stop the trains. Adjacent bogies must align directly above hook points. Use stations to help alignment, though trains need not dock.
Once aligned, power the coupler to couple or decouple depending on mode and relation.
After coupling, the rear train merges into the front train. Its ID is lost, timetable drops at the hook, and assigned timetables are discarded.
If the rear train's bogie is one block behind the station marker during decoupling, it is considered docked at that station.
When creating a train at a station, the station's facing direction is defined as the train's forward direction.
On decoupling, the front train keeps its name. The rear train is renamed “Split off from: Original Name.”
On coupling, the front train's name is chosen as the new train's name.
Train couplers can act as data sources for display linkers.
Behind the station, a track shows a blue marker. Right‑click with train casing to create a bogie. After the first bogie, more can be added behind.
Build structures on bogies, ensuring they stick together and include a train cab. In the GUI, assemble them into a train structure, connecting all bogies.
If the target track is a curve, trains cannot be created.
&6Create Train
Train structures must be glued together and include a forward‑facing cab.
To let mobs drive trains, place a seat or Blaze Furnace in front of the cab.
Assemble Train

ftbquests.chapter.create.quest9085184306: Place a Steam Engine or Steam Whistle on any fluid tank structure to turn it into a boiler.
Boilers need water input and a heat source beneath. They have three attributes: size, water, and heat, each with 18 levels. Efficiency depends on these. Wear Engineer Goggles to see details.
Size level = volume / 4, Water level = water (mB) / 50, Heat = total heat from sources. Blaze Furnace burns as tier 1, super burn as tier 2.

Extinguished Blaze Furnaces, campfires, fire blocks, magma blocks, and lava act as passive heat sources. Passive boilers always output 2048su stress, and multiple passive sources don't increase efficiency.
Boilers can only be heated from below.
To output power, place a Steam Engine on the boiler and a shaft two blocks in front. Power comes out from the shaft.
Boilers produce stress = boiler level × 16384su. Stress is evenly split among engines. Each engine outputs max 16384su, so add enough engines to use all stress. Match engine count to boiler level.
Extra engines beyond the required number don't increase efficiency.
Steam engine speed depends on boiler state and ratio of engine count to level, ranging 16–64 RPM.

ftbquests.chapter.kots.quest283988599646: The territory mod used here is OPAC. You can claim chunks to protect them or keep them force-loaded.

To give another player permission to operate in your claimed chunks, if they're in a different team, type &2 /openpac-parties ally add [playername]&r. (Note: if the player isn't in any team, this command won't work.)
To revoke a player's permission in your claimed chunks, just type &2 /openpac-parties ally remove [playername]&r.
Players with ADMIN rights in the team can also use this command.
To leave a team, type &2 /openpac-parties leave&r.
If you're the team creator, type &2 /openpac-parties destroy confirm&r to delete the team.
To rename your team, type &2 /openpac player-config set parties.name [new name]&r.
To rename your claimed chunk, type &2 /openpac player-config set claims.name [new name]&r.
[How does the team system work?]
In most cases, it's recommended that each player creates their own team, and only invite others when necessary.
Here's how the team system works:
Press &a[M]&r to open the world map, right-click a chunk, then click “Claim this chunk” in the popup to make it yours.

&2"Team 1"&r has only &2Player A&r. &6Player C&r uses the command to ally &2Team 1&r with &6Team 3&r. This means &2all players&r in &2Team 1&r can operate in chunks claimed by &6Player C&r. But &6Team 3&r does not automatically gain rights in &2Player A's&r chunks. Meanwhile, since &dPlayer B&r is in &dTeam 2&r and &6Player C&r didn't ally with &dTeam 2&r, &dTeam 2&r players cannot operate in &6Player C's&r chunks.
However, if &2Player A&r and &2Player B&r are both in Team 1, then when &6Player C&r allies with any member of &2Team 1&r, &2all players&r in Team 1 gain rights in &6Player C's&r claimed chunks.
&aTL;DR: &l&bIt's best if every player creates their own team&r. That way, when allying with other teams, you won't accidentally give permissions to strangers.
You can also drag with right-click to select multiple chunks at once.
Alternatively, you can type &2 /openpac-claims claim&r or press &2 ' &r to claim the current chunk.
Once you have claimed a chunk, type &2 /openpac-parties create&r to make your team.
To invite players to your team, type &2 /openpac-parties member invite [playername]&r.
Or, players can join a team directly with &2 /openpac-parties join [teamID]&r.
To set permissions for team members, type &2 /openpac-parties member rank [rank] [playername]&r.
To kick a player from your team, type &2 /openpac-parties member kick [nickname]&r.
&4Did you really read it all?

The /home command from Narcissus Farewell behaves a bit oddly.

For default homes (&2/sethome home true&r), using &2/home&r will try to teleport to the default point in the current dimension. If none exists but there's only one default point across all dimensions, it will teleport cross-dimension to that one. Using &2/home <name>&r will teleport directly cross-dimension.

For private homes (&2/sethome home&r), using &2/home <name>&r only works within the same dimension. If none exists, no teleport occurs. To teleport to another dimension's home, specify the dimension: &2/home <name> true minecraft:overworld&r.

ftbquests.chapter.stuff.quest45236107783: &aJust Enough Items (JEI)&r is the most famous Minecraft item manager, common in modpacks. Use it to view recipes and usages.
You can search beneath the inventory. Methods:
&aDirect search&r “Apple” shows all items with that word in their name.
Prefix &a@&r to filter by mod. E.g., “@create frog” searches items from Create containing 'frog'.
Use &a-&r to exclude keywords, e.g., “apple -golden” hides Golden Apples.
For keywords containing spaces, wrap in quotes &a""&r.
Advanced search (rarely needed):
Search by tooltip only: prefix &a#&r.
Search by tag: prefix &a$&r.
Search by creative tab: prefix &a%%&r.
Open your inventory; the item browser on the right is JEI.
Multi‑search: separate keywords with &a|&r, e.g., “wrench|hammer”.
How to use:
Use the top‑right controls to change pages.
Hover an item and press &a[A]&r to favorite it; it appears on the left side. Press &a[A]&r again to unfavorite.
Press &a[R]&r or left‑click inside JEI to see recipes.
Press &a[U]&r or right‑click inside JEI to see usages.
Items shown in Recipes/Usages can be further searched in the same way.
If you're in a compatible GUI, press &a[+]&r on a recipe to quick‑fill materials; hold &aSHIFT+[+]&r to fill as much as possible.

ftbquests.chapter.tofu.quest963342085054: A mysterious crop that sometimes appears when breaking grass—seems drinkable once pulped.
&bThis chapter involves lots of fluid conversions, so it's best to complete Create basics first.

ftbquests.chapter.tofu.title: &aSoymilk Star Visitor
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1032815196: &bThis chapter is tough for beginners; recommended to finish “Facing the Soil” and “Gourmet Beginner” first.
&bThe mod has changed a lot recently, so quests are for reference only.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1213898240: Might scream when pulled. Occasionally seen in Dark Forests—such a strange plant.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1406660928: A grown‑up's drink. Wild coffee generates in jungle biomes; harvest coffee cherries and slice them on a cutting board to get beans.
&aYou can also bring a Sniffer into jungle biomes to find ancient coffee beans.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1669821630: Drink every kind of tea—you probably have your own refined understanding by now.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1700288908: Grind coffee into fine powder for a moka pot. Fill the bottom with spring water and heat; steam pressure pushes water up to extract the coffee.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest1955790599: &8Red beans are another basic ingredient, found in birch or coniferous forests. They must be planted on poor soils like sandy clay.
&aIn this pack you'll see another kind of red bean. Right‑click dirt with red beans to convert it into red‑bean soil, which periodically grows red bean sprouts. Left‑click to harvest.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest2099683309: &bIf semi‑yokai form lasts more than 5 minutes, it immediately ends and grants full yokai form for 20 minutes. Each monster‑meat dish eaten adds 4 minutes. Buffs: +30%% speed, +50%% attack damage, +20 max health. While active, monster‑meat dishes give triple hunger and saturation. You can also trade with Rumia.

&bHunger drains much faster, even from actions that normally don't consume hunger (standing still, walking). If hunger runs out, the effect ends. To maintain it, eat nourishing foods or craft a Milk Hat.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest2215360969: Put tea leaves into a kettle, add water, and set it on the stove to brew.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest2664041987: In semi‑yokai or full yokai form, you can trade with Cirno to obtain this—an inexpensive way to fly.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest2924956963: Another grown‑up's drink, found in the Blooming Forest biome.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest3490693000: Place a drying rack under sunlight to use nuclear energy to remove moisture from items.
A steamer, on the other hand, cooks food while retaining moisture. It must sit on a pot of water, can be stacked upward, and should be topped with a steamer lid.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest4426455675: The shrine maiden is delighted and gives you her ribbon.
&bActivates creative flight. Danmaku damage pierces magic defense.
&aIf you lose the ribbon, you can claim another here.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest4724233267: After drinking every type of coffee, you surely have your own favorite.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5059729968: You drunkard—how can you drink so much!
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5113236723: You've taken another step on the road to becoming a gourmet.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5232963444: Whoa—after eating this mysterious meat you feel so strange!

&bWhile under this effect, monster‑meat dishes give double hunger and saturation. Eating more monster‑meat dishes extends the effect by 1 minute each. If held in the Nether, a Koishi phone event may occur.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5608582098: &bWhen worn, grants continuous semi‑yokai form. Killing zombies, skeletons, piglins, or wither skeletons always drops their heads.
&aIf you lose the headband, you can claim another here.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5734716971: &8Soybeans are the most basic material in Gensokyo, used to craft many items. Wild soybeans can be found in swamps; pick the pods and split them to get soybeans.&r

&aWith research into the mysterious soybeans of the Soymilk Star, people realized they are essentially the same as Gensokyo soybeans. They are easier to plant and yield more, gradually replacing the wild variety.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5960318537: New versions add different cookware for preparing various foods. Soup pots require stirring with a ladle.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5980545261: Place grapes inside and stomp them to obtain grape juice. Collect it with a glass bottle or large bottle.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest5982060593: A shabby extendable mechanical hand. Its original purpose was stirring soup in the pot.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest6089204296: How did you defeat her? Did you use some underhanded trick!
&aIf you lose it, you can claim another here.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest6441907671: Koishi seems to like you this way and wants to play together. As thanks, she gives you her beloved Mr. Hat, which helps you avoid other yokai.
&bProvides continuous Unconscious effect, and using red or blue danmaku consumes nothing.
&aIf you lose Mr. Hat, you can claim another here.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest6978631131: With the Illusion Moon Lamp, cultivating Udumbara becomes much easier.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest7416716034: In the wild you often find yokai houses, inhabited by a Rumia. Inside you can find mysterious meat of unknown origin. Eating it seems to cause strange changes…
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest7642455508: After becoming a yokai, you can buy strange things from Rumia…
&bIn mid‑game when guns or the four special hats are hard to make, danmaku is a good damage option. But its damage counts as magic, not projectile.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest8107277486: Udumbara only grow in swamps, but seem to need artificial cultivation to have enough medicinal effect.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest8226170461: Though precious, Udumbara can be cultivated on a large scale.
&aOne possible approach: after making an Illusion Moon Lamp, use maids or daylight sensors to harvest on a timer.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest8739240544: Even a little frog can stand against wind and rain!
&bProvides continuous blessing of the Native God; using cyan or yellow‑green danmaku consumes nothing.
&aIf you lose the hat, you can claim another here.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest8792570233: Unlike the imitation Udumbara Flower used in the Night Sparrow Restaurant, this is a true Udumbara infused with moonlight.
Udumbara bloom only under a full moon. On non‑full moon nights they stop at the stage before maturity; at dawn they wither back to the lowest growth stage.
ftbquests.chapter.youkai.quest8851317970: Fermentation barrels can be used to brew soy sauce and alcohol.
